items.sentence: Do you think that Tom has any chance of winning?
I don't think Tom knows why Mary went to Boston.
I don't think Tom knows where Mary wanted to go.
I don't think Tom knows where I went to college.
I don't think Tom knows when Mary's birthday is.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was tough.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was tense.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was short.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was lucky.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was bossy.
Tom told me that he thought that I looked drunk.
Tom told me that he thought that he had the flu.
Tom told me he just needed a shoulder to cry on.
Tom told me he didn't remember Mary's last name.
The possibility Tom might get lost worried Mary.
I'm pretty certain Tom doesn't know how to swim.
I'm almost certain Tom will go swimming with us.
Is there any chance Tom isn't going to be there?

Tom told me he thought that Mary would be alone.

I couldn't have done it without everyone's help.

Tom told us about all the things that he wanted.
A lot of bad singers think they're good singers.
Tom is really handsome, but he's not very smart.
The bus driver was the only one who wasn't hurt.
How old were you when you got your ears pierced?
Mr. Jackson was my worst teacher in high school.
I hope that you have a wonderful time in Boston.
Tom and I've been friends for over thirty years.

Is baseball really more popular than basketball?
It's a pity you can't come to my birthday party.

We should be in Australia by this time tomorrow.
Babies learn to crawl before they learn to walk.
Tom and Mary walked off together, holding hands.

The meeting lasted a lot longer than I expected.
I wish that I'd known what you were looking for.
I don't feel like going for a walk this morning.
We don't have much snow here even in the winter.

I told the police that Tom had tried to kill me.
